title: Build a longest word finder app
desc: Given a sentence, find and return the length of the longest word. This teaches string manipulation, splitting, and iterating over elements while keeping track of a maximum value.

arg: The quick brown fox jumped over the lazy dog
The lord of meatballs is kootfe!

hint: Split the sentence into words and iterate through them, keeping track of the longest.

title: Sum of even numbers
desc: Calculate the sum of all even numbers in a given array. This teaches iteration, conditionals, and accumulation patterns.
hint: Loop through each element and add it to a sum if it is divisible by 2.

title: Reverse a string
desc: Return the reversed version of an input string. This teaches string manipulation, loops, and building new data from existing data.
hint: Iterate from the end of the string to the start, building a new string.

title: Find max in array
desc: Return the largest number in an array. This teaches comparison operations and tracking a 'current best' value during iteration.
hint: Start with the first element as the max, then iterate and update if you find a larger number.

title: Count vowels
desc: Count the number of vowels (a, e, i, o, u) in a string. This teaches character checking and conditional logic inside loops.
hint: Loop through each character and check if it matches any vowel.

title: Sum of two largest numbers
desc: Return the sum of the two largest numbers in an array. This teaches sorting, comparison, and working with subsets of data.
hint: Find the largest number, remove it from consideration, then find the next largest.

title: Check palindrome
desc: Determine if a string reads the same forwards and backwards. This teaches indexing, symmetry, and conditional logic.
hint: Compare characters from start and end moving towards the center.

title: Fibonacci number
desc: Return the nth Fibonacci number. This teaches recursion or iterative calculation and understanding of sequences.
hint: Each Fibonacci number is the sum of the two previous numbers; implement recursively or iteratively.
